comments.body: why do you export before setting it?

I export separately from setting because I noticed a campaign to make the corresponding change for local declarations.   Separating them makes the result code of the setting available.  That other campaign was motivated by some script-checking tool with which I am not familiar.  I thought I might as well use some of the same hygene here.

I have no particular motivation for one ordering or the other.  Testing showed that the existing ordering works.

To clarify, I wasn't asking why you export separately from setting it, which seems fine, but why you do export _before_ setting it (in the un-commented-out version). To be more concrete, shouldn't the un-commented-out `FLANNEL_OTHER_NET_CONFIG=''` line go before the `export FLANNEL_OTHER_NET_CONFIG` line?

Yes, I understood the question and thought I answered it.  As far as I know both orderings work.  I tested the one you see here.

``` shell
mspreitz@ursula:~$ foobar='x'
mspreitz@ursula:~$ bash -c 'echo $foobar'

mspreitz@ursula:~$ export foobar
mspreitz@ursula:~$ bash -c 'echo $foobar'
x
mspreitz@ursula:~$ foobar='y'
mspreitz@ursula:~$ bash -c 'echo $foobar'
y
```

I'm not sure you ever want to pass `--config=` to the kubelet. If you want to default to not passing a config flag you should check to see if this var is set and if so pass the flag with the value and otherwise omit the flag. If you always want to pass the flag but want to allow it to be overridden, then you could make the default value be `/etc/kubernetes/manifests` to match your previous PR.

I do want to pass `--config=""` to the kubelet. It's also the default case.
I don't believe It's a proper path to set it as `/etc/kubernetes/manifests` w/o any assumption.
The default value for that flag is empty, so passing it with the default value works (even though it's redundant which can be confusing). If you prefer it that way though, that's fine with me.
My concern for passing this path w/o alerting the users could lead to potential conflict, let alone it's a recommended path in docker-k8s setup process.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +39,43 @@
# Path to the config file or directory of files of kubelet
export KUBELET_CONFIG=${KUBELET_CONFIG:-""}

# A port range to reserve for services with NodePort visibility

@@ -1,1 +36,40 @@
# Admission Controllers to invoke prior to persisting objects in cluster
export ADMISSION_CONTROL=NamespaceLifecycle,LimitRanger,ServiceAccount,ResourceQuota,SecurityContextDeny

SERVICE_NODE_PORT_RANGE=${SERVICE_NODE_PORT_RANGE:-"30000-32767"}

comments.body: :+1: to this.  It shouldn't have been added here since Ubuntu is using a specific version that does not contain this plugin.  Thanks for the catch.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +36,40 @@
# Admission Controllers to invoke prior to persisting objects in cluster
export ADMISSION_CONTROL=NamespaceLifecycle,LimitRanger,ServiceAccount,ResourceQuota,SecurityContextDeny

SERVICE_NODE_PORT_RANGE=${SERVICE_NODE_PORT_RANGE:-"30000-32767"}
